FIX for Controller not working / Camera view stuck (confirmed)

-Download and install C++ redist package from link found on http://code.google.com/p/x360ce/wiki/MainPage
-Download the most recent xbox controller emulator http://x360ce.googlecode.com/files/x360ce.App-2.0.2.90.zip 
-Extract to the Darksiders install directory. Run the exe file to config controller.
-Shutdown all config / controller profiler programs before running the game.

Fix for SAVED GAMES not loading:  

-Cause by issue between STEAM and game where the game ends up looking for saved games in the wrong location. With the crack that's used, your saved games folder has to be ...\Documents\My Games\Darksiders\ (for Vista / Windows7, I don't know what it is for XP, etc.)
-Case 1 (easy fix) - STEAM was not active during 1st game launch. STEAM is active in the background and you're running the game.  Turn STEAMclient off -> run game -> it should load games properly. If still doesn't work, try recopying cracked content from iso to the game folder.
-Case 2 - STEAM was active during 1st game launch.  The game then set itself to the STEAM settings for saved games which directly conflicts with cracked content settings .  If you're lucky, simply recopying cracked folder from iso to game directory will fix it. But most likely, after uninstalling you'll have to manually search + purge residual game-related files in hidden folders before you attempt a re-install.  Easiest way to do get around this: Load a System Restore point before game was initially installed.  Otherwise - file search on entire C:\ hard-drive - search darksiders*.* then delete *folders* of the search results.
(Yeah major pain in the ass, I know. It's due to STEAM using anti-piracy settings that are saved in remote locations that usually set as hidden).

Potential FIX for game crashing during certain scenes:
(assuming AMD logo file fix already attempted).

1 - Download + install the K-Lite Codec pack with default codec settings - http://www.free-codecs.com/download/k_lite_codec_pack.htm
Use Codec Tweak Tool to detect and fix broken filters. This is the codec pack I use and I haven't encountered any game crashes at all (I haven't beaten the game quite yet, but I know I'm close to end).
2 - (VISTA users only) - Download + Install Vista Services Optimizer http://www.snapfiles.com/get/vsoptimizer.html
After install use the "Automatic Tuneup" feature to optimize windows for max performance. Restoring Window's default service configuration will work too - but has lots unneeded services that eat up too much virtual memory and thus slows system performance.

Fix for SAVED GAMES not loading: 

-Cause by issue between STEAM and game where the game ends up looking for saved games in the wrong location. With the crack that's used, your saved games folder has to be ...\Documents\My Games\Darksiders\ (for Vista / Windows7, I don't know what it is for XP, etc.)
-Case 1 (easy fix) - STEAM was not active during 1st game launch. STEAM is active in the background and you're running the game. Turn STEAMclient off -> run game -> it should load games properly. If still doesn't work, try recopying cracked content from iso to the game folder.
-Case 2 - STEAM was active during 1st game launch. The game then set itself to the STEAM settings for saved games which directly conflicts with cracked content settings . If you're lucky, simply recopying cracked folder from iso to game directory will fix it. But most likely, after uninstalling you'll have to manually search + purge residual game-related files in hidden folders before you attempt a re-install. Easiest way to do get around this: Load a System Restore point before game was initially installed. Otherwise - file search on entire C:\ hard-drive - search darksiders*.* then delete *folders* of the search results.
(Yeah major pain in the ass, I know. It's due to STEAM using anti-piracy settings that are saved in remote locations that usually set as hidden).

To wrap up the soluttions to common problems that are stated in this thread and the ones I personally encountered, we have the following:

Problem 1: Halfway done with the installation, it asks for disc 2. When you mount disc 2, it keeps on asking for it.

Solution: set a folder to contain non-rar (not image) installer. mount disc 1 and go to "my computer" the right click the mounted disc, choose "open" or "explore" , select all files then copy them to your previously set folder. Do the same for disc 2 (mount, open, copy to the previously set folder)

Now you have the non-rar (not image) installer. When you install the game, it will progress till the end.


Problem 2: the epic loop of c++/directX part of installation

Solution: install c++/directX once and hit ctrl+alt then del to enter windows task manager, choose LOG OFF to terminate all running applications. After you log in, everything is normal again and you may now crack the game using the crack folder.

Logging off spares the option of directly hitting the power button of your CPU. 



Problem 3: The black screen after THQ and VIGIL logo.

Solution: from program files/darksider/media/video, rename or delete the amd logo (the first video file there) so the game skips it everytime it's launched.


Problem 4: the xbox controller/ "only looking up" thing.

I'm sorry I can't help you with this one because I finished the game using keyboard and mouse, ftw :)


Problem 5: the damn horseman in the ashland arena won't be killed

Solution: at first, it was a game feeze/crash. When I mounted to Ruin again and press the button prompted, the kill cutscene finally played.


Problem 6: the cinematics'/cutscenes' audio stutters

Solution: It's an issue even in legitimate owners. It's minor for me but if it's enough to hinder your enjoyment, try updating your audio drivers. 


So far, those are the problems that I can address. I really had fun with this game so for anyone who also finished this game, please contribute. thanks :)
